Subjective: Headache ~2 months, worsening. Right side > everywhere, sometimes diffuse. Mild nausea with worst pain, no vomiting. Glare in vision, no flashes. Photophobia, prefers dark room, worsened by talking. Initially once, then weeks without, now almost weekly (at least once), lasts few days. Unable to play volleyball on vacation due to headache. Tried paracetamol (some relief), ibuprofen (worked well). No increased stress. Family Hx: Father migraines, grandfather cluster headaches. No coffee/energy drinks. No smoking, no illicit drugs. Occasional alcohol (2-3 beers/time). Student (medicine, 2nd year). Exercises 4x/week (workout, run, cycle). Request: Worried about diagnosis (migraine vs. cluster headache), wants best course of action.
Objective: BP 120/80. Pulse 50 bpm. Cranial nerves intact. Fingertip-nose test good. Arm/leg strength good. Romberg normal. Tandem gait slightly off.
Assessment: Suspect Migraine. No signs of cluster headache.
Plan: Start pain relief immediately at symptom onset:
Keep headache diary (provided) to identify patterns/triggers (e.g., stress, coffee).
Safety net: Return sooner if symptoms worsen or change significantly.
